item.title: Palabra del día: ‘halcyon’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 53 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?

item.title: Word of the Day: halcyon
item.description: This word has appeared in 53 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Sri Lanka Declares ‘Largest’ Disaster as Cyclone Death Toll Rises to 355
item.description: The president called the nationwide flooding the largest and most challenging natural disaster in the island’s history, as emergency rescue efforts continue.
item.dc:creator: Pamodi Waravita and Mujib Mashal

media:content.media:description: A flooded street after heavy rainfall in Wellampitiya, Sri Lanka, on Sunday.

item.title: ‘Heated Rivalry,’ Plus 8 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: A new show based on a Canadian sports romance novel airs. And a reunion of ‘The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives’ recaps the third season.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: Connor Storrie, left, and Hudson Williams in “Heated Rivarly.”

item.title: America’s Backyard Isn’t as Quiet as It Looks
item.description: Latin Americans have proved surprisingly acquiescent to U.S. aggression — but that won’t last forever.
item.dc:creator: Brian Winter
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: The guided-missile destroyer Sampson near the entrance to the Panama Canal in September, part of the U.S. military buildup in the Caribbean.

item.title: No Corrections: Dec. 1, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Dec. 1, 2025.

item.title: For These Businesses, U.S. Tariffs Are a Price Worth Paying
item.description: Some British business owners are determined to keep their access to American consumers, but they are facing trade-offs.
item.dc:creator: Eshe Nelson

item.title: Quote of the Day: Ukrainian Civilians Captured by Russia Face Special Terrors
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, December 1, 2025.

item.title: Having a Cellphone at Younger Than 12 Could Carry Health Risks, Study Says
item.description: Researchers found higher rates of depression, poor sleep and obesity among tweens who had early access to a cellphone.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Pearson

media:content.media:credit: Claire Merchlinsky/The New York Times; Photographs via Getty Images

item.title: Get Ready, America: Here Come China’s Food and Drink Chains
item.description: China’s fast-food and beverage chains have an opportunity to expand in the United States and escape cutthroat competition at home.
item.dc:creator: Daisuke Wakabayashi, Joy Dong and Ava Pellor

media:content.media:description: Staff members preparing drinks at Heytea in Times Square. The chain has its roots in Jiangmen, in southern China.

item.title: ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Season 1, Episode 6 Recap: Daddy’s Little Girl
item.description: Ingrid’s connection to the evil entity known as It is revealed, among other dangerous secrets.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:description: It turns out Ingrid (Madeline Stowe) has a clownish side.

item.title: Viajaba a casa de sus padres por Acción de Gracias y fue deportada a Honduras
item.description: Any Lucía López Belloza, de 19 años, fue detenida por agentes de inmigración en el aeropuerto de Boston antes de un vuelo para sorprender a su familia en Texas. Ahora está en Honduras.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch and Annie Correal

media:content.media:description: Any Lucia López Belloza celebrando su graduación de la secundaria en Texas.

item.title: Daniel Woodrell, ‘Country Noir’ Novelist of ‘Winter’s Bone,’ Dies at 72
item.description: His tales of violence and squalor in his native Ozarks had the timeless quality of fables and inspired several movies.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

media:content.media:description: Daniel Woodrell in 2007. “He writes high Greek tragedy about low people, and he never panders or looks down on the people he writes about,” the writer Dennis Lehane said.

item.title: 10-Minute Challenge: The Two Fridas
item.description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.
item.dc:creator: Larry Buchanan

item.title: Tom Stoppard Wrote Dialogue for Indiana Jones and Obi-Wan Kenobi
item.description: The playwright won an Academy Award for “Shakespeare in Love.” But he was also a prolific script doctor who worked with filmmakers like Steven Spielberg.
item.dc:creator: Eric Grode
item.category: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (Movie)

media:content.media:description: Sean Connery, left, and Harrison Ford during the motorcycle chase scene from the film “Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade.”

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 1, 2025
item.description: Bundle up for Hannah Binney’s Monday crossword puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: The Oxford 2025 Word of the Year Is ‘Rage Bait’
item.description: And if you’re angry about it, that just proves the point.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Schuessler

item.title: Biyouna, Algerian Star With Tart Tongue Onscreen and Off, Dies at 73
item.description: For generations of Algerians, the fierce independence of her persona reflected their struggles in a country torn by civil war and repression.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter

media:content.media:credit: Eric Fougere/VIP Images, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Biyouna in 2015. She was a hero in the working-class Algiers neighborhoods from which she had sprung.

item.title: Heavy Snow Disrupts Travel in Midwest and Great Lakes Region
item.description: A sprawling wintry storm brought heavy snow and gusty winds to the Midwest and the Great Lakes region over the weekend, canceling more than 2,000 flights at airports across the country.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:description: Chicago was getting snow on Saturday and might get an accumulation of six to 10 inches, forecasters said. The city has not experienced a significant late-November winter storm in four or five years.

item.title: College Student Is Deported During Trip Home for Thanksgiving
item.description: Any Lucia López Belloza, 19, was detained by immigration agents at the Boston airport before a flight to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving. She is now in Honduras.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch and Annie Correal

media:content.media:description: Any Lucia Lopez Belloza celebrating her high school graduation in Texas.

item.title: ‘Imperial Israel’ in the New Middle East
item.description: A series of attacks show how Israel has expanded its reach in the region.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:description: After an Israeli drone strike in Lebanon in September.

item.title: Paige DeSorbo, Carol Lim and Other Fashion Tastemakers Share Where They Love to Shop
item.description: As The Times compiled its list of the 50 best clothing stores in America, we asked 16 tastemakers about the stores they like.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: James Riches, Fire Chief Who Lost Firefighter Son on 9/11, Dies at 74
item.description: He spent months searching the wreckage of the World Trade Center for his son’s remains, then suffered lung illnesses attributed to toxic dust.
item.dc:creator: Carol Rosenberg

media:content.media:credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: James J. Riches, a retired deputy fire chief, sitting beside photos of his son Jimmy. After the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001, he spent months in the wreckage, searching for Jimmy’s remains.

item.title: The 50 Best Clothing Stores in America
item.description: Transporting, surprising and specialized, these stores keep alive the thrill of in-person shopping and are worth the trip — even if nothing is bought.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz, Misty White Sidell, Jon Caramanica, Gina Cherelus, Miya Lee, Alex Vadukul, Jacob Gallagher, Stella Bugbee and Sadiba Hasan

item.title: Trump muestra contradicciones al anunciar un indulto al expresidente de Honduras
item.description: Dos declaraciones del presidente Trump en las redes sociales, realizadas con menos de 24 horas de diferencia, mostraron la disonancia de su campaña contra el narcotráfico.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump habló durante una videollamada con miembros del servicio militar el jueves.

item.title: Fuzzy Zoeller, Who Won Two Majors on the PGA Tour, Dies at 74
item.description: He was a witty and popular figure, but his racially insensitive remarks about Tiger Woods at the 1997 Masters led to death threats and many apologies.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir

media:content.media:description: Fuzzy Zoeller in 1979 receiving his green jacket from Gary Player, left, after winning the Masters Tournament. Five years later, he won the United States Open.

item.title: Stream Movies Written by Tom Stoppard: ‘Shakespeare In Love’ and More
item.description: Spinning off Shakespeare, waltzing through Imperial Russia, bantering about literature or diving deeply into history, Stoppard shared his gifts on the screen.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Vincentelli

item.title: Netanyahu pide al presidente de Israel el indulto en su juicio por corrupción
item.description: El inusual llamamiento del primer ministro israelí al presidente Isaac Herzog se produjo semanas después de que el presidente Donald Trump hiciera la misma petición.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Kershner

media:content.media:description: El primer ministro israelí, Benjamín Netanyahu, habló en noviembre en el Parlamento israelí, en Jerusalén.

item.title: Review: It’s Hard to Breathe in This ‘Walküre’
item.description: The singers did marvelous work at the Opéra Bastille in Paris, where the director Calixto Bieito’s new staging takes place in a hellish dystopia.
item.dc:creator: Oussama Zahr

media:content.media:description: In a new production of “Die Walküre,” Wotan builds a surveillance state to hold on to power.

item.title: Love Clothes? We Want to Hear About Your Favorite Stores.
item.description: Tell us about the places big and small, new and old, where you have the most fun shopping in person.
item.dc:creator: Kellina Moore

item.title: JOH, el expresidente a quien Trump planea indultar inundó EE. UU. de cocaína
item.description: El exmandatario hondureño ayudó a orquestar una conspiración de narcotráfico durante décadas, asolando a su país. Trump lo considera víctima de persecución.
item.dc:creator: Santul Nerkar, Annie Correal and Colin Moynihan

media:content.media:description: Cuando Juan Orlando Hernández fue extraditado a Estados Unidos, su propio país estalló en celebraciones.

item.title: Lawmakers Suggest Follow-Up Boat Strike Could Be a War Crime
item.description: Top Republicans have joined Democrats in demanding answers about the escalating military campaign the Trump administration says is aimed at targeting drug traffickers.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:description: Representative Mike Turner, Republican of Ohio, raised concerns about the recent operations in the Caribbean.

item.title: Protesters Arrested After Trying to Block a Possible ICE Raid
item.description: Nearly 200 protesters tried to block federal agents from leaving a parking garage in Lower Manhattan on Saturday. The confrontation appeared to prevent a possible ICE raid nearby, and led to violent clashes between the police and protesters.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:description: The scene of the protest was just blocks from where a large-scale immigration raid took place last month.

item.title: ‘Zootopia 2’ Goes Wild at the Worldwide Box Office
item.description: The Disney sequel took in $156 million in North America over its first five days. Strong turnout in China pushed the film’s global opening total to $556 million.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes

item.title: A Turkey Fried Rice Recipe for Thanksgiving Leftovers
item.description: When you need to use up those last bits of dark meat, two carrots and a half-bag of green beans, turkey fried rice is there for you.
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Nico Schinco for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Kaitlin Wayne.
media:content.media:description: Kia Damon’s turkey fried rice.

item.title: Storm Threatens to Bring ‘Widespread and Impactful’ Snow and Ice to Northeast
item.description: A potential nor’easter could leave as much as a foot of snow in the Poconos in Pennsylvania, the Catskills in New York, and parts of Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Vermont, a forecaster said.
item.dc:creator: Nazaneen Ghaffar

item.title: Pope Leo Calls for a Two-State Solution in Mideast Conflict
item.description: The pope, arriving in Lebanon, also encouraged that country’s Christians to stay where they are, despite economic, political and security concerns.
item.dc:creator: Motoko Rich

media:content.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Pope Leo XIV arriving in Beirut, Lebanon, on Sunday.

item.description: Read the document

item.title: Glenn Close, Ethan Hawke and Others Mourn Tom Stoppard
item.description: Nobody advanced or cherished the English language more than Stoppard, Tim Curry noted. Colleagues and fans agreed.
item.dc:creator: Jesse Green, Michael Paulson and Laura Collins-Hughes

media:content.media:credit: Don Hogan Charles/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Tom Stoppard with Jeremy Irons and Glenn Close, who both starred in the 1984 Broadway production of the playwright’s “The Real Thing.”

item.title: The Uneasy Mix of God and Country
item.description: Readers respond to a column by David Brooks about Christian nationalism. Also: A hope for a different kind of president; a view of Meta as not a monopoly.

item.title: It’s OK That Our Long, Mostly Good Marriage Ended
item.description: Four years ago, my husband and I made an increasingly common choice: We hugged, apologized for our shortcomings and freed each other.
item.dc:creator: Cathi Hanauer

item.title: Rubio Says ‘Much Work’ to Be Done After Talks With Ukrainian Officials
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and other U.S. officials met with a Ukrainian delegation that was without Andriy Yermak, who resigned as chief of staff to Ukraine’s president on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Cassandra Vinograd

media:content.media:description: From left: Steve Witkoff, a White House special envoy, Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law, during a meeting with Ukrainian officials in Hallandale Beach, Fla., on Sunday. The talks were headed by Rustem Umerov, head of Ukraine’s National Security and Defense Council, center right.

item.title: The Dangers of E-bikes
item.description: Injuries and deaths are rising — but the law hasn’t kept up.
item.dc:creator: Adam B. Kushner

media:content.media:credit: Balazs Gardi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Near Tamalpais High School in Mill Valley, Calif.

item.title: Hong Kong’s Migrant Domestic Workers Mourn Their Losses in Deadly Fire
item.description: At least eight workers died, and many of those who survived, after saving children and others in their care, are worried about losing their jobs and being forced to leave.
item.dc:creator: Anjali Tsui and Francesca Regalado

media:content.media:description: Filipinos taking part in a community prayer service on Sunday in Hong Kong for the victims of the Nov. 26 fire in the Tai Po district of the city.

item.title: Netanyahu Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Him in Corruption Cases
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the contentious appeal weeks after President Trump had made the same request to the Israeli president.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Kershner

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel speaking in November at the Knesset in Jerusalem.

item.title: Sunday Special: Gifting Books for the Holidays
item.description: Books are your answer to the difficult question of what to give.
